Title: D’Tigress defeat Senegal to reach Afrobasket final
Summary: Nigeria’s D’Tigress defeated a hard-fighting Senegal to reach the final of the 2025 Afrobasket on Saturday . The Nigerian team won 75-68 in a keenly contested game .

Title: FG moves to gazette nurses’ scheme of service
Summary: The Federal Government has promised to gazette the Nurses’ Scheme of Service approved by the National Council on Establishments (NCE) in 2016 . Already, the Federal Ministry of Health and Social Welfare has written to the Office of the Head of the NCE .

Title: Ilara kingdom set to mark Oba Ogunsanwo’s fifth coronation anniversary
Summary: Ilara kingdom set to mark Oba Ogunsanwo’s fifth coronation anniversary . The lush and peaceful kingdom of Ilara in Epe Division, Lagos State, is set for a major celebration this month .

Title: Shettima, Adesina, Makinde break ground for Ijaiye Agribusiness hub
Summary: Vice President Kashim Shettima, African Development Bank President Dr. Akinwumi Adesina, and Oyo State Governor Seyi Makinde performed the groundbreaking ceremony for the Ijaiye Agribusiness Industrial Industrial Hub .

Title: LP chieftain hails INEC for disqualifying Abure-led faction’s candidates
Summary: Oluchi Oparah hails INEC for disqualifying candidates submitted by Julius Abure-led faction . Former National Treasurer of the Labour Party, Oluchi said the commission has “restored sanity and restored sanity’s sanity .

Title: Military dismantles drug cartel, denies demolishing civilian properties in Jaji
Summary: Military authorities at the Jaji Military Cantonment in Kaduna State have  dismissed as false reports of the demolition of civilian properties located within areas under the cantonment .

Title: 2027 Realignment: Peter Obi, Atiku  and the numbers that cannot be ignored
Summary: As the 2027 general elections inch ever closer, it is imperative that opposition forces engage in a sober and honest introspection . Peter Obi, Atiku  and the numbers that cannot be ignored cannot be ignored .

Title: Lagos and the Yoruba…
Summary: The lethal cladding of extreme power could blind, and constrain a man, so much that he might fall into the ditch, and still think himself powerful .

Title: It’s not easy adapting to the ‘stranger’ your partner has turned into!
Summary: It’s not easy adapting to the ‘stranger’ your partner has turned into! You think you have your priorities sorted out, your principles just so . Then it happens. Just how much pain a person in love can put up with?

Title: 94, 000 doctors, nurses ‘Japa’, Nigeria struggles for replacement
Summary: With an estimated population of about 234.5 million in 2025, Nigeria is expected to hit 401.3 million by 2050 . Nigeria is, undoubtedly, one of the most populous nations in the world .

Title: Messi injured in Inter Miami’s leagues Cup win
Summary: Lionel Messi suffered an injury and was removed in the 11th minute of Inter Miami’s Leagues Cup win over Necaxa . Title: Tinubu hails D’Tigress for reaching fifth consecutive AfroBasket final
Summary: The reigning champions booked their spot in the final after defeating Senegal 75–68 in a semi-final clash at the Palais des Sports in Treichville, Abidjan, Côte d'Ivoire on Saturday . This will be the team’s fifth consecutive appearance at the championship game . President Bola Tin

Title: Itasin Imobi: Ogun community where roaming elephants kill residents
Summary: Itasin Imobi, a fishing and agrarian community in Ogun State’s Ijebu East Local Government Area, is nestled within a lush forest . Title: Contender de Ridder calls out Adesanya
Summary: Renier de Ridder has declared his readiness to face former two-time champion Israel Adesanya . The New Zealander has expressed his admiration for the Nigerian-born New Zealand fighter whilst calling for a bout between the pair . ‘The Last Stylebender’ is currently enduring a three-fight losing spiral that began with his

Title: APC threatens Nigeria’s unity, progress – El-Rufai
Summary: Former Kaduna State Governor, Nasir El-Rufai, has called for collective efforts to sack the ruling All Progressives Congress in the 2027 general elections .
